Posts.Content: Lovely news to read. X
Posts.Title: Results Are In :)

Posts.Content: Hi Tweets20 I feel exactly the same. Check my boobs every day but over the last few weeks feel like scar tissue is a bit harder and bigger. Then wonder if it’s just in my head. It’s so so hard to switch off after all this. I am so sensitive to every twinge and pain now then when I think about it I feel like the twinges and pains get worse. It’s a vicious circle.
Posts.Title: Lumpy breast 18 months after lumpectomy and radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Thanks for your message GRANNY59 maybe ill call my BCN to see what she thinks.
Posts.Title: Safe vitamins to take after treatment

Posts.Content: I’ve just finished chemo, waiting to start Radiotherapy would like to start taking some vitamins to improve my immune system. Was wondering what you all take if anything?  I don’t want to risk taking anything unsafe and am a bit more cautious what I’ll put in my body these days.  Thanks.
Posts.Title: Safe vitamins to take after treatment

Posts.Content: Hi all. I am starting chemo on Monday. 4 cycles of EC.  Just wondering if anyone is able to give me any advice on what to expect and if there is anything I should be doing/buying in preparation. Thanks
Posts.Title: 1st cycle of EC on Monday - advice please

Posts.Content: Ah thanks Dreamthief, that’s really helpful.  I think I am only having the 4 EC then onto Radio & Tamoxifen.  Why pineapple especially? Is there something in it that helps?  I’m dreading the mouth ulcers part so will go and get a bottle of the wash this weekend - thanks.
Posts.Title: 1st cycle of EC on Monday - advice please

Posts.Content: Love it. Thank you!! Weirdly I have been buying pineapples fresh ones for the past 2 weeks. I have been putting them in smoothies and eating them as they are.
Posts.Title: 1st cycle of EC on Monday - advice please

Posts.Content: I love this thread. If I hear “at least...” once more. I’ve returned back to work and I’ve had it loads. People just don’t get it. I am going to live in fear every day that it’s going to make a return, but “at least” I don’t look like I’ve had cancer or “at least” you are back to work and can move on. Lol yeah thanks mate I’ll just move on from that year of hell and pretend it didn’t happen shall I. Does anyone have a magic wand to hand?
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: lesleyhelen Thanks so much I feel better hearing that!!
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - DIBH technique

Posts.Content: Has anyone else had to do be deep breath technique for Radiotherapy? I’ve been told I need to do it as my heart is too close to the area they are treating.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - DIBH technique

Posts.Content: Hi, I’m waiting for chemo 4 cycles of EC. I had clear nodes but the thing is I am still really worried it’s spread somewhere else. I have been getting a pain in my left shoulder and the side of my next (right side) which gets worst at night.  Has anyone else had these symptoms? I want to let my oncologist know and maybe ask for a scan or something. They didn’t seem worried last time I mentioned it. Maybe it’s a bit of health anxiety kicking in, but it’s on my mind all the time, especially at night as that’s when it’s painful most. Is the best thing to do call my BCN? I am starting chemo on Monday.
Posts.Title: Constant worrying

Posts.Content: NatK1 you look incredible with the wig and without! Not many people can pull both looks.  In answer to your question a while back (sorry only just seen your reply), I am having 4 cycles of EC then onto Radiotherapy for 4 weeks.  Think I might try and give cold cap a go, but worried I’m going to be disappointed.  I have a 10 year old too, a girl x

Posts.Title: Wig purchase advice

Posts.Content: Hi. I’ve had this test done. It took about 3 weeks to come back. Mine came back 27 which is the high end of borderline for cancer returning. I was referred for chemo and radiotherapy. Started on Monday. Good luck. Hopefully yours will come back low.
Posts.Title: Oncotype Dx Test

Posts.Content: Hi Lucklady. Yes I returned to work while waiting for results. I had a week off after the lumpectomy and worked up until my first chemo appointment. I have now been signed off. I felt ok keep busy up until chemo as I didn’t really feel ill until now, but there is honestly no way I could have worked this week.  I understand it’s really hard to know what to do for the best. My emotions have been so up and down and I really haven’t felt with it at times.  I think we really do just have to take this one day at a time. You might not even need chemo so I would just carry on as normal as you can x
Posts.Title: Oncotype Dx Test

Posts.Content: Hi @Firemanswife  Can I just say that reading about your period returning has made my day. I am 34 and having chemo at the moment. So worried about mind not returning. I’ve heard and read a lot of things about fatigue during Radio so I wouldn’t be surprised if it’s that don’t worry about it being anything sinister. You body has been through so much it’s no wonder you are feeling like this. X
Posts.Title: Fatigue?

Posts.Content: Hi Emily. I had a lumpectomy on 15 May this year. I would say it took about 5 weeks from my op to feel that the use of my arm was beginning to feel normal again.  I had worries like you during the healing process. I had a heavy feeling all of the time under my arm pit and I felt very firm around the site of where the lump was removed. I ended up going to see my GP as I was getting back really anxious, she said I might have a mild infection and gave antibiotics. I think she was more covering all bases Incase. They really worked so I must have had something mild to shift as the pain went.  It is really important to do your exercises during this time. How are you getting on with them?  Do you know how many lymph nodes were removed? It’s still early days for you, don’t get down, you will come out of the other side. I don’t think a lumpectomy is a minor op at all. It’s a lot to go through and if anything all the waiting around in between makes it worse too.  Take care x
Posts.Title: SNB post op nerve pain and dragging
